result.execSummary:
The defendant Tessa J. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

records.addlTxt: 8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tessa J. Anderson in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Tessa J. Anderson. Defendant pleads no contest; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders sentence withheld, 12 months probation, any treatment deemed necessary, AODA, continue treatment with current mental health and AODA providers, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:54 PM Defendant Tessa J. Anderson in court with attorney Philip J. Brehm.  David Zarwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1,000 with conditions, no contact with A.M. and Motel 6 Court appoints attorney Brehm. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.M. and Motel 6 , his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
